codeSystems.name: ObservationInterpretationCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Interpretation Codes
codeSystems.description:
A categorical assessment, providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation value,    such as “normal”/ “abnormal”,”low” / “high”, “better” / “worse”, “susceptible” / “resistant”, “expected”/ “not expected”.    The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.   
   
   Notes:
   
   This is being communicated in v2.x in OBX-8 (Observation Interpretation), in v3 in ObservationInterpretation (CWE) in R1 (Representative Realm) and in FHIR in    Observation.interpretation. Historically these values come from the laboratory domain, and these codes are extensively    used. The value set binding is extensible, so codes outside the value set that are needed for interpretation concepts    (i.e. particular meanings) that are not included in the value set can be used, and these new codes may also be added to    the value set and published in a future version.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-: US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile

codeSystems.name: Common UCUM units
codeSystems.description: Commonly encountered UCUM units (for purposes of helping populate look ups.

codeSystems.name: LanguageCodesWithLanguageAndOptionallyARegionModifier
codeSystems.title: Language codes with language and optionally a region modifier
codeSystems.description: This value set includes codes from [BCP-47](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). This value set matches the ONC 2015 Edition LanguageCommunication data element value set within C-CDA to use a 2 character language code if one exists,   and a 3 character code if a 2 character code does not exist. It points back to [RFC 5646](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646), however only the language codes are required, all other elements are optional.

codeSystems.name: USCoreConditionCodes
codeSystems.title: US Core Condition Codes
codeSystems.description: This describes the problem. Diagnosis/Problem List is broadly defined as a series of brief statements that catalog a patient's medical, nursing, dental, social, preventative and psychiatric events and issues that are relevant to that patient's healthcare (e.g., signs, symptoms, and defined conditions). ICD-10 is appropriate for Diagnosis information, and ICD-9 for historical information.

codeSystems.name: USCoreLaboratoryTestCodes
codeSystems.title: US Core Laboratory Test Codes
codeSystems.description: Laboratory LOINC codes: From the introduction to August 2022 LOINC Users' guide; "The current scope of the existing laboratory portion of the LOINC  database includes all observations reported by clinical laboratories, including the specialty areas: chemistry, including therapeutic drug monitoring and toxicology; hematology; serology; blood bank; microbiology; cytology; surgical pathology; and fertility.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-: US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile

codeSystems.name: USCoreProcedureCodes
codeSystems.title: US Core Procedure Codes
codeSystems.description: Concepts from CPT, SNOMED CT, HCPCS Level II Alphanumeric Codes, ICD-10-PCS,CDT and LOINC code systems that can be used to indicate the type of procedure performed.

codeSystems.name: UspsTwoLetterAlphabeticCodes
codeSystems.title: USPS Two Letter Alphabetic Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines two letter USPS alphabetic codes.

codeSystems.name: USCoreCommonSDOHAssessments
codeSystems.title: US Core Common SDOH Assessments ValueSet
codeSystems.description:
Common SDOH assessment concepts covering the following categories (Gravity Project SDOH Domains):
 - Food (Food Insecurity)
 - Housing (Housing Instability)
 - Health (Social Connection, Stress)
 - Employment (Employment Status)
 - Care (SDOH Category Unspecified)
 - Transit (Transportation Insecurity)
 - Money (Financial Insecurity)
 - Goods (Material Hardship)
 - Education (SDOH Category Unspecified)
 - Legal (SDOH Category Unspecified)

codeSystems.name: USCorePaCodesValueSet
codeSystems.title: US Core PA Codes ValueSet
codeSystems.description: A starter set of Physical Activity codes based off the [Physical activity IG](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/physical-activity/)

codeSystems.name: USCoreTreatmentInterventionPreferencValueSet
codeSystems.title: US Core Treatment Intervention Preference ValueSet
codeSystems.description: A code representing an individual's medical intervention (treatment) preferences.

codeSystems.name: Hl7VSSpecimenCondition
codeSystems.title: hl7VS-specimenCondition
codeSystems.description: Concepts of modes or states of being that describe the nature of a specimen.  Used in Version 2 messaging in the SPM segment.

codeSystems.name: ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType
codeSystems.title: ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType
codeSystems.description: A role of a place that further classifies the setting (e.g., accident site, road side, work site, community location) in which services are delivered.

codeSystems.name: USCoreCareExperiencePreference
codeSystems.title: US Core Care Experience Preference Codes
codeSystems.description: A code representing an individual's care experience preferences.

codeSystems.name: USCoreMedicationstatementStatus
codeSystems.title: US Core Medication Status Codes
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the state of the statement.  Generally, this will be active or completed state.  This value set excludes the concept used internally by the FHIR specification, not-taken,on-hold,stopped, and unknown, because they are covered by the medication adherence extension.
